intro: Scuticaria peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian scuticaria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in mountainous areas with cool climates. Scuticaria peruviana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
